text:
e="preserve">Mohamed Hamed Hassan Khan ( ; 26 October 1942 – 26 July 2016) was an Egyptian-British movie director, screenwriter and actor. He was a well-known member of the "1980s generation" in Egyptian cinema, along with directors such as Khairy Beshara, Daoud Abdel Sayed, Atef El-Tayeb, and Yousry Nasrallah. His 1983 movie "The Street Player" was entered into the 13th Moscow International Film Festival. He was known for directing "Ayyam El Sadat", "Mr Karate" and "Before the Summer Crowds".
Khan died on 26 July 2016 at the age of 73.
